alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; South Central Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 27 at 4:50AM EDT until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: .Hurricane Ian is forecast to move north-northeast toward the Florida Peninsula mid to late week. Forecast rain amounts associated with this system are 5 to 10 inches with locally higher amounts. Heavy rainfall may produce flooding along creeks and rivers and in urban, poor drainage and low-lying areas. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida and northern Florida, including the following areas, in northeast Florida, Coastal Duval, Coastal Flagler, Coastal Nassau, Coastal St. Johns, Eastern Clay, Eastern Putnam, Inland Flagler, Inland St. Johns, South Central Duval, Trout River, Western Clay, Western Duval and Western Putnam. In northern Florida, Bradford, Central Marion, Eastern Alachua, Eastern Marion, Gilchrist, Western Alachua and Western Marion. * WHEN...Through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a Flood Watch for portions of northeast Florida. Heavy rainfall of 5 to 10 inches is forecast, which may lead to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; South Central Duval
